thread.title: Ground News - Volunteers hand out hundreds of blankets in Orlando as temperatures drop
thread.title_full: Ground News - Volunteers hand out hundreds of blankets in Orlando as temperatures drop

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Volunteers hand out hundreds of blankets in Orlando as temperatures drop
text:
Summary by Ground News The Christian Service Center in Parramore collected blankets and handed them out. Executive Director Eric Gray said volunteers distributed more than 500 blankets already. It was a record year for the service center as far as rescuing adults and children. Gray asked, even if you couldn't donate, to go into the new year with a different outlook on humanity. WKMG Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Graham Holdings Volunteers hand out hundreds of blankets in Orlando as temperatures drop The cold temperatures can cause even tougher times for those most at risk, such as those experiencing homelessness in Central Florida.The Christian Service Center has been working all week to try and bring them some warmth. “The shelters are full and there’s really not a lot of places for people to go here in Orange, Seminole and Osceola counties,” said Executive Director Eric Gray.
